body.name: REOLINK Home Security Camera System, 3MP HD Plug-in Indoor WiFi Pan Tilt Pet Camera, Baby Monitor, Night Vision, 2 Way Audio, Smart Human/Pet Detection, Local microSD Card Storage, E1(2 Pack)
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 1 hr 50 mins
features: E1 2K Indoor wifi camera captures Super HD videos in the resolution of 2304x1296 (3 megapixels), and with 8 infrared LEDs, it can see up to 40ft in the dark.
Plug it in. Connect to 2.4 GHz WiFi. Up and running in minutes. Rotate 355° horizontally and 50° vertically. See every corner of your home with easy pan and tilt control on Reolink app or client.
The indoor camera can smartly analyze the shape of people and pets to accurately detect their motion and send you real-time motion-triggered alerts.
You can remotely see live streaming via free Reolink software. With built-in mic and speaker, you can hear and speak through the pet camera.
Support Alexa/Google Assistant. Control your wifi cameras hands-Free with your voice. NOTE: 2-year Warranty.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Previous page Enjoy Real-Time Communication Anywhere Listen and talk to your family or pets with the built-in mic and speaker when you are not at home. 355° Pan & 50° Tilt, Get More Areas Covered Rotate the camera to see all corners of the room and quickly turn to the presets to check key areas. Bring Mommy and Baby a Sound Sleep Infrared LED lights make it easier to see every move of your baby clearly in a dim room. Multi-User and Multi-Camera Live View Via the Reolink App, you can view up to 9 cameras at the same time and share them with family. Easily Relive the Memorable Moments Finding important video clips is made much easier by smart event filters and the timeline. Next page 1 Two-Way Talk 2 Pan & Tilt 3 3MP Night Vision 4 Remote Access 5 Smart Playback

Previous page More Accurately Focus on What You Need Capture important moments like kids toddling around and naughty pets running through the house. Privacy Mask and Record Schedule Available Set a privacy area or record schedule to prevent something from being captured by the camera. Reduce Unwanted Alerts with Detection Zones Draw motion zones to let the camera focus on noteworthy areas. Distractions will be greatly reduced. Powerful Audio Alarm for Abnormal Situations Customize the motion-activated siren to let it respond to emergencies for you in no time. Next page 1 Human/Pet Detection 2 Privacy Protection 3 Motion Zone 4 Customizable Siren

microSD Card Storage This camera supports scheduled, or motion-triggered recording. You can store the videos on the microSD card (up to 128GB, NOT included). NVR Storage You can realize 24/7 monitoring when connected with Reolink NVR. Build your own security camera kit. Smart Home Integration Check and manage your home with just a voice command to Alexa or Google Assistant. Enjoy a smart and automated home. Secure Data Encryption Your privacy is our priority. To protect you and your home/business against malicious intent, we use advanced algorithms to encrypt your videos.

Easy Setup within 5 Mins Initial setup can be done within a few taps on your phone. Simply scan the QR code on the camera via the Reolink App and follow the intuitive instructions shown on the app. Ethernet connection is also an option if the wireless connection is not available. User-Friendly Installation Robust wireless connection and pan-tilt movements enable maximal flexibility in placement for Reolink E1. Put it on the desk or mount it to the ceiling, power it up, connect it to 2.4 GHz WiFi, and you can scan your whole room. It's that simple.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best on the Market in this price range
reviews.reviewText: I went through three other security camera vendors, all from "top" security camera companies found here on Amazon and in big box retailers, until I came across this security camera. This camera has by far met and exceeded my expectations.First, the price was the most competitive, even though I would be willing to pay more for a better quality camera and not waste my time trying to find the right one. Next, the ease of installation and image quality/ pan feature was above all the others (one other cameras even had silly/ childish voices congratulating you on the installation process). I also liked that you can make a recording setting to allow the camera to record after it stops sensing motion activity. Several of the cameras I tried did not allow this. This camera allows you to use a SD card to store your images, not playing a game that you have to upload your videos to their web and then pay a monthly/ hidden fee.Finally, what I really like is you can load the app on your phone but also on a Mac or PC (I think) and view the videos from your laptop, all the others didn’t allow me to do this.. Streaming/ viewing the images can be sometimes slow and jittery, but that may even be my Internet connect. If you are patient, it will load/ store on the app and then you can see the video with no issues.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value, Customer Support helped when we had issues.
reviews.reviewText: Was relatively easy to install and pair to the app on my phone. Quality is good enough for keeping an eye on the house. They offer 1 month renewable cloud storage (so you have to renew each month, but it's free so you can't beat that).Edit: Months later cloud storage no longer recognized camera and would not allow me to add it again. Months after that wifi connection keeps failing. I tried restarting camera, resetting router, hard reset of camera (only to be unable to add camera due to wifi connection failing). I noticed troubleshooting mentions wifi password cannot have special characters. Ours does and it had worked fine until then. I sent message 1 week ago through their customer support form on their website and no response.. Pretty disappointed in customer service and the fact that this camera has become useless. Very frustrating having to wait to get support (and not being able to speak to a person to resolve it immediately). Considering cameras are used for security, I'm not sure I would recommend this anymore.Edit #2: Support did contact me back and we worked through the problem. Our wifi has split 2.4 and 5ghz bands. Both are named the same thing and after an internet outage it looks like the camera was trying to connect to the 5ghz. I had to rename the 2.4 ghz and reconfigure the connection on the camera.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Keep tabs while away
reviews.reviewText: It is a very simplistic wireless camera. Will not knock your socks off, but doesn't really disappoint either. The video quality is "blah", but good enough to see all that is needed. Fine detail in video will not be found. Sound quality is weak, but good enough to understand what is being said, and communicate 2-way. Adjusting camera in real time isn't all that bad surprisingly. There is a normal delay in moving the camera angle as expected, considering if you are across the country even, and the lag is only a few seconds. Night vision is very good. I believe the night vision exceeds expectations for this little, less expesnsive device. a little more detail in picture quality than color/daylight at times.The big downfall I had with this device is motion detection. Seems the camera detects light intensity changes within the room a bit too easily. I have curtains and blinds, and still the sun going in an out from behind the clouds trips the motion sensor, regardless of what sensitivity I select. Room gets brighter then darker, the camera sees it. Constantly sends me notifications on my phone and recording to SD card.Camera takes a micro-SD card. Does not come with one, you need to buy it. No larger than 32Gb. App downloaded to phone is very easy to use, no frills, and basic. Settings easy to figure out.Setting up the unit is a hassle if you have dual band router. Select the 2.4ghz band, not the 5ghz. It will not recognize the 5Ghz band properly, consistently, nor reliably. A very simply setup process altogether, after that. Any issues will likely be getting the camera and router to recognize one another - remember, 2.4Ghz and your router password is the key!All in all, I would purchase again for cheap video monitoring of each room. I disconnect each one till I need them. When needed, plug back in, and they will connect shortly to your network and you can access all cameras on your phone within a few minutes. I would not pay any more than $35-$40 for this unit, as I believe this is it's limit in terms of overall quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good smart camera with easy set up
reviews.reviewText: First time i tried a wifi smart camera, and i am very pleased with the performance, great video quality with audio, amazing app makes it easy to check my place anytime and anywhere, with great options available inside the application menu.Two cons are:1.The app takes some time to response the command when used remote2. Night vision is average.

reviews.reviewerName: Le falta filo a las herramientas

reviews.reviewTitle: Good but stability & quality can be improved
reviews.reviewText: It's a good device and compatible with a previous Argus Model I bought 2 years ago.The setup is the same and quite easy.However, the light in night mode needs to be constant in the room because the contrast is not good in the dark area.The quality is less good that the Argus, and the reference point was lost already twice within 1 week of usage. Not a big deal, but just to reprogram it. So far so good
